intro: Eschscholzia rostellata, commonly known as the narrowleaf poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking orange to red petals and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is part of the Papaveraceae family. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Eschscholzia rostellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used historically for medicinal purposes.
